description: Memory is a fundamental part of human existence, but what do we currently know about the neurobiology that underlies this remarkable ability? In this seminar, students present and discuss recently published research that examines the neurobiology of learning and memory from molecular, cellular, behavioral and cognitive neuroscience perspectives. Prerequisites: Psychology 238 or Neuroscience 234. Offered most years.
name: NeurobioLearnMem
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Psychology 238 or Neuroscience 234. Offered most years.
title: Neurobiology of Learning and Memory
